content: after trying several free patterns for a crocheted shamrock or four-leaf clover i decided i didn t like any of them and improvised my own i ended up liking my final product enough that i decided to write it down and share with everyone after expressing their admiration for the design my non-knitting parents and always-knitting older sister will be sporting their own copies of this cute shamrock pin on st patrick s day pattern available for free in my blog more pictures to come - - - - - - - - - - - 3/18/09 - a smart little bird told me via ravelry comments that a true shamrock is only three leaves so while this may be a nice pattern for a four-leaf clover you should leave out one repeat from each round to make a shamrock thank you to corcracroise person for pointing that out to me i m only 1/16 irish a regular american mutt = - - - - - - - - - - - 10/22/09 - check out laurazlsk 1 s modification on the stem looks really nice 1 http //www ravelry com/people/laurazlsk
